intro: Pteroneuron parallelum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, with a height typically ranging from 10 to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, attracting various pollinators. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as fields and woodland edges.
